a.g: By the fig and the olive
We have certainly created man in the best of stature;
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din (Verbatim V3)

ğŸ“– Vol 4: Patience and Gratitude
And similarly, Allah (the Exalted) created the creation, and they in the beginning of their innate disposition (Fitrah) need to use the desires (Shahawat) to perfect their bodies with them, so they distance themselves with them from His presence (Hudur). And indeed their happiness (Sa'adah) is in proximity (Qurb) to Him. So He provided them with the blessings (Ni'am) that they are capable of using to attain the degree of proximity. And concerning their distance and proximity, Allah (the Exalted) expressed when He said: 'Indeed, We created the human being (Al-Insan) in the best form (Ahsan Taqwim), then We return him to the lowest of the low (Asfal Safilin), except those who believe.' Therefore, the blessings (Ni'am) of Allah (the Exalted) are instruments (Alat) by which the servant (Abd) ascends from the lowest of the low. Allah (the Exalted) created them for the sake of the servant so that he may attain with them the happiness (Sa'adah) of proximity (Qurb). And Allah (the Exalted) is independent of him, whether proximity or distance. And the servant (Abd) in them is between using them in obedience (Taa'ah), so he would have given thanks (Shakar) for conforming to the love (Mahabbah) of his Master (Mawla), and between using them in his disobedience (Ma'siyah), so he has disbelieved (Kafar) for plunging into what his Master (Mawla) dislikes and does not approve for him. For indeed Allah does not approve for His servants disbelief (Kufr) and disobedience (Ma'siyah). And if he neglects them and does not use them in obedience (Taa'ah) nor disobedience (Ma'siyah), then it is also disbelief (Kufr), a denial (Kufran) of the blessing (Ni'mah) through waste. And everything created in the world is only created as an instrument (Alah) for the servant (Abd) so that he may connect with it to the happiness (Sa'adah) of the Hereafter and attainment of proximity (Qurb) from Allah (the Exalted). So every obedient one (Muti') is, according to his obedience (Taa'ah), giving thanks (Shakir) for the blessing (Ni'mah) of Allah in the means (Asbab) which he used in obedience (Taa'ah). And every lazy one (Kaslan) who abandoned the use or disobedient one (Asi) who used them in the way of distance (B'ud) is a disbeliever (Kafir) straying in other than the love (Mahabbah) of Allah (the Exalted). So disobedience (Ma'siyah) and obedience (Taa'ah) encompass them both the will (Mashiyyah), but they do not encompass them both the love (Mahabbah) and dislike (Karaha). Rather, perhaps a desired thing (Murad) is beloved (Mahbub) and perhaps a desired thing (Murad) is disliked (Makruh).

a.g: Then We return him to the lowest of the low,
Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?
Is not Allah the most just of judges?
